website_summaries.verdict: The Lone Peak 4.0 Mid Mesh is a durable neutral running shoe from Altra. Designed for off-road running, the shoe features a good balance of comfort, underfoot protection, and impressive grip. The shoe has also been used by some buyers for hiking. Though some people have issues with price, sizing and weight, overall, the shoe has proven to be a successful release.
pros: Based on some user reviews, the Altra Lone Peak 4.0 Mid Mesh feels comfortable even after long hours of standing and walking
The shoe offers a good level of underfoot protection, said a few users
Several wearers admired the mid-cut design of the shoe because it gives them ankle support
A few noticed that it is as breathable as the previous version
A couple of runners lauded the shoe's amazing grip on muddy and wet running surfaces
Many purchasers admired the upper of the shoe because it keeps the shoe dry and warm
cons: According to a few users, the shoe runs smaller than usual
A few mentioned that it feels heavy

customer_reviews.title: Already in the trash
customer_reviews.text: After two months, already trashed. Don't buy. Altra Lone Peak are running boots with several design flaws, that make them get stuck between rocks often, also they make me trip over a lot when running in rocky areas.. a bit of a nightmare really. The rear end of the soles get caught by anything pretty much (roots, rocks, etc). The toes area should be more protective or have better and stronger protection.. it gets scratched easily, and make then start falling apart even after the first time of running with them. I don't recommend them unless Altra changes those important issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cano, Javier, Mr.

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hiking-trail "fast-walker". The sizes run a hair small, I had to return 12's for 12.5's. I usually wear 12's in other brands. This is not a waterproof mountaineering boot, but a fast, flexible, grippy, wide toe box shoe. Ultimate comfort, it is a living extension of your foot. I did notice a separation of the upper from the sole after about 100 miles on the trail. I contacted Altra, submitted a warranty claim, and they sent me a new pair, as asked for, even though the purchase was 3rd party through Amazon. I own several pairs of various boots and runners, but by far the 3.5 and 4.0 mids are my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: tim lambdin

customer_reviews.title: Help with Mortons.
customer_reviews.text: My recent diagnosis of Mortons Neuroma predicated my purchase of these boots. The fit and comfort are great. If you are on the fence with these boots, I can tell they will help if you have the same condiction with your feet. If you are considering these to prevent future injuries then your looking in the right direction. Get them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Purington

customer_reviews.title: Best trek shoe. SUPERB
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid outdoorsman and a former scout leader. Gone through dozen or more hiking shoes and boots. These are the best. Very comfortable, amazingly durable, light as a feather, and water resistant. Trekked all over Iceland in these. Including glaciers. You won’t regret this purchase. Get em 1/2 size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Dunno

customer_reviews.title: Major Improvements!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a major improvement from the 3.5 version. The toe box is still wide as with all altras, but the arch and heel seem to fit more narrow than the previous versions. The upper material seems to be more resilient and helps keep your foot in place. I plan on using these on section hike on the Appalachian Trail this spring and summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mykel Buhler

customer_reviews.title: Great supportive hiking trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend and he loves them!!! He has a low top pair, but he wanted ankle support for hiking. He wore them for the first time last weekend and was so happy with them. They grip like "Spider Man" and there is ankle support. We were watching the AC 100 Race in the Angeles National Forest and we hiked up some steep hillsides to get good views. They performed wonderfully. The only reason I put no arch support is that these are zero drop shoes and are advertised to not have arch support.
customer_reviews.author: outdoors gal

customer_reviews.title: Beast on the Trails!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, I just hiked 63+ miles on the AT with these puppies. Out of four guys hiking, I was the only one that hike all 63+ miles with absolutely no foot issues, no hot spots, no blisters, nothing nada. Awesome shoe!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Palacios

customer_reviews.title: Only for easy trail hikers
customer_reviews.text: Hiked for three days in these shoes on moderate to hard trails. It did not hold up. Front toe guard lifting, side of shoe lifting. These shoes are made for casual walkers, low impact terrain, maybe a slow trail run. Own several pairs of altra low tops trail shoes, these were a disappointment. Redeeming quality: Altra still has the best grip For steep downgrades.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: NOT WIDE
customer_reviews.text: These do not run wide. I usually wear 11EE. These are as narrow as any other standard width shoe. They may seem wide because the toe does not taper. Also they were shorter than the usual designs, perhaps losing length to the blunt shape. Foot volume wise they ran small. I struggled to get them on and they were tight across the top of my foot where the reinforcing strap is. This with laces completely loose. There is nothing large or wide about these shoes. Otherwise they seemed like good quality but obviously I can't really say. I only tried them on for a minute or two.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brown

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight comfortable hikers
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Altra boots and I was impressed with the comfort of thes shoes. These are very lightweight and fit a wide foot very comfortably. The insole gives good cushioning. I noticed the difference with the zero drop heel right away as it didnt give that higher up heel feeling. The company recommends switching between these and regular shoes every other day to get used to this difference. My initial impression is wow!! I have a hike coming up and will be wearing these.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Moate

customer_reviews.title: Same sizing between Lone Peak 2.5 to 4
customer_reviews.text: I had the Lone Peak 2.5's in a size 11.5 (smaller than my typical 12 in most other brands) and ordered these in size 11.5 too. Exact same fit. Also had Altra Instincts in the same size. I'm glad I didn't follow some of the other posts here saying this run small. If you're an Altra wearer, you're probably the same size in these. Just got them, but they feel great and just like I expect from Altra. I hope the quality and durability have improved (my only gripes from past Altras)
customer_reviews.author: Really Picky Guy

customer_reviews.title: great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a 3 day ultralight backpack trip and loved them. I dont think I will ever use full leather hiking boots again. These Altras are so comfortable and have super traction. The only thing you have to watch for is scuffing on the top of the toe box. I can see it wearing thru if you do it too much. These shoes also have great air flow for your sweaty feet and dry out quickly! If your on the fence about buying them, just buy them already!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb comfort and support
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes and it will be tough to go back to anything else after these. I have taken on several hikes now and unlike some other reviews I see no major signs of wear yet. Could have been luck and gotten a well put together pair. The fit is incredibly comfortable and the extra room for the toes makes me wonder why other shoes don’t take advantage of this design. I will buy these again as soon as they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle O

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for terrain races, hiking, trailing etc.
customer_reviews.text: Now I bought these for a spartan beast race ( my first race ) and these were PERFECT. The terrain along with being muddy, rainy and multiples inclines or downhills on top of obstacles. I seen countless people slipping and falling and these were amazing how well they gripped. I’m swollen from the race but not ONE blister on neither of my feet. I put these in the wash and let them air dry and they look just like NEW. Great material, super sturdy and lightweight. Trust me , it’s worth it. Excited to buy these for my partner so we cam go hiking and do some races together.
customer_reviews.author: Izzarial

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the 3.5's
customer_reviews.text: I like the 3.5's better. These don't breathe as well, but seem more water resistant, due to the different mesh material. It's a very tight weave, and feels like plastic. Much different than the nice airy mesh on the 3.5's.. Still a good shoe. Though expensive, and not very durable, they aren't the most cost-effective.
customer_reviews.author: Galt, J.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is unreal
customer_reviews.text: I could hike all day in these shoes, rock hopping, climbing, running through run down trails. Everything on the inside is phenominal but the design on the sides ripped off immediatly when I was hiking through overgrown bushes.. And it looks like the tongue was gonna go bad in the next couple of hikes because most of my hikes needed cleats.
customer_reviews.author: Shattered screen

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shoe for me. Exactly what I needed if you have need a wide to box your really can't go wrong and having a zero drop shoe changed my walking and hiking. I know it's not for all people but it happened to be a right fit for me. I would try in store first to make sure it's a right fit I should have gotten a 10.5 instead of a 10 but even with them being a little too small they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes EVER!
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable, breathable and lightweight work shoe I have ever worn! I walk around 10 miles a day at work, delivering packages for a very well known company we all use, and I don't think I'll ever go to another brand as long as this shoe exists. It keeps little rocks out too. There is a gator that goes with these but I have not tried them sinceIdon'tfind them necessary. Also, no break in period. Great traction. Just got them so I have no idea how many miles I'll get but I don't think I care when they are this comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: lightweight with ankle support
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for summer hiking not trail running and they have worked perfectly so far. I was looking for something lightweight with ankle support. So far I have only used them for a 15 mile hike in the Adirondack high peaks. Held up fine for the hike. The bottom half of the shoe feels very much like a lightweight running shoe and the top half feels like a hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wood

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I haven’t read anything about the little hidden feature on the outside heal. It’s a Velcro so you can attach Dirty Girl shoe gaiters. Most shoes you need to attach a Velcro with adhesive. Shoes are super light. I’ll follow up later after I have added a few miles.
customer_reviews.author: Juke Worx

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe from altra
customer_reviews.text: I got a size 13 and it fits as expected. I like the higher collar, gives some ankle protection. Tread is deep and great for off pavement. Has plenty of room, only complaint is the laces. They are way too long, and difficult to tighten, but easily replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Good 0 drop trail running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I want to move towards 0 drop barefoot. But while running initially wanted some thing which has some cushion. This is a very good choice if you are in the same path.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a recommendation in a hiking blog. I thought I was spending a lot but after being on some gruesome hikes, I think it is a really great investment. The shoes are super light but sturdy, have a great grip, hold micro spikes really well.
customer_reviews.author: Nick N

customer_reviews.title: Fave hiker in a hi top
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep using my lone peak trail runners but needed ankle support for hiking, so these were the next best thing. I’ve only gotten out once since I got then but they felt comfortable and have great traction, which is what I’ve come to expect from the Altra trail runners. I’m looking forward to lots of good hiking in these.
customer_reviews.author: Hikerchick

customer_reviews.title: AGING FEET
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of boots that give room for my toes, but fits my heel. As I aged (72) my toes spread out, but my heel stayed the same width which made it impossible to find a boot to fit both my heel and provided room for my toes. Why more companies don't compete for this market is beyond me we all age. I normally wear size 14 EEE size 15 fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kim I. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my wife and I a pair of these and both of us wonder... Why did we wait so long. Hiking in these was amazing. We have done multiple hikes since getting these and I will never go back to my old hiking boots. Keep in mind that these are warm, dry weather hiking shoes. don't expect them to keep your feet warm or dry in the snow or rain but that is not what they are made for.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Great to wear, tough to get on
customer_reviews.text: Like all Altra shoes, make sure to buy up one size from other brands for max toe comfort. The shoe is awesome to wear. Getting it on can be a chore since even with laces loosed it stays pretty tight across the top of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: James Thompson

customer_reviews.title: love high tops for running hiking and looking good!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Altra high-tops. Own the 4.0 and 3.5, different colors. Wish I could find the 3.0 or 3.5's in my size. I'd buy every color. Big toe box is the key for me! They look good too!
customer_reviews.author: BigJSalami

customer_reviews.title: Will altra make a Work boot with zero drop?
customer_reviews.text: snug around the ankle, little less cushioning than the 3.0, tight putting them on, Just okay. had them for 9 months, wore them to work 5 days a week and did yard work and hiking, no blisters, no toe issues, feet felt good. don't like the added rubber flap on the heel, what is that anyway. I like altra shoes for my forefeet, get little to no blisters and my toes are not sore, even the pressure of corns are virtually gone. Wear a size 12, and they fit around my foot fine, far better than many other sneakers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe until the sole separates after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable outdoor shoe I’ve ever worn. Toe box is ideal for my size 15 feet. Light, grippy and better than expected arch support. Unfortunately, the glue has already come undone on both front soles and I’ve gotten no response on 2 emails asking for a way to exchange them. It might be amazon interface or retailer error but regardless it’s a bad look for Altra.
customer_reviews.author: SteveRoxbury

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I trail run alot and have had foot cramping issues with narrow toed shoes. I tried wider designs by solomon, northface and even under armour but didn’t wanna go full minimus toe shoes. These foot shaped bottoms take the cake when it comes to compromise over multiple weekly 3-5 miles trail runs over sharp rocks, natural trails.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian g gallegos

customer_reviews.title: White mountain killers!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Altra lone peaks! Being an avid hiker of the white mountains, these fit perfectly through rugged terrain and I barely notice they are even on my feet. I have spent thousands on shoes and boots for hiking and nothing compares to these I highly recommend. Most will be lifelong customers once they try them.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: These are legit!!! Super comfy! Light weight enough to run and workout in tough enough for pretty rugged hiking. I also use them on the farm sparingly and they do great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love them
customer_reviews.text: What doesn’t work is what they call Zero Drop. The heel feels lower than the rest of the shoes. I wanted like they but they hurt my knee that’s been replaced. Pushed the joint into an uncomfortable position. They reminded me of the Earth shoes I wore in 1973.
customer_reviews.author: St. Louis Cards

customer_reviews.title: Aggressive tread great for outdoor training.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for ankle support and they do just that... I have this same shoe in the low runners version and they feel the same on my foot. Love the larger toe box.
customer_reviews.author: kfs818

customer_reviews.title: amazing footwear
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are incredibly comfortable and durable, even when used on hard hikes in the backcountry and in bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: Ross R Conover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved ALTRA shoes since I was introduced to them about 5 years ago. I have wide feet and these do the trick to keep me comfortable and pain free during the my workouts. I now own 4 pairs of these, different colors and they all fit the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Deanna Lyman

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe, but
customer_reviews.text: these are too small, i did not see the advice to get these larger than my standard shoe. waited too long to0 return them my mistake
customer_reviews.author: Gregory E. McKelvey

customer_reviews.title: Wide toe box was a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Really appreciated having the bigger toe box. First time ever after having sore toes my whole life.. not sure I can tell the difference with zero drop.
customer_reviews.author: mark d cotterman

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and nice looking. Very different from normal running shoe. Worth a little extra.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Altra lone peak4.0 mesh mid sz11
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, they feel like walking in bare feet, but with traction, stability, support, oh and did I mention comfort, these are the most comfortable mids I have ever had on, the size, toe box(wide) and the construction of the boot is very impressive, however, I only give 4 stars because I'm not sure of the durability yet and want to give honest review. I will be buying another pair
customer_reviews.author: Bill Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Sizes off.
customer_reviews.text: As so many people have said, the shoe was WAAAAY smaller than the size indicated, of course that's only based on EVERY other shoe and boot I own. Who buys shoes over the internet anyway? I must have lost my mind.
customer_reviews.author: W. Conroy

customer_reviews.title: Hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking shoes with very good grips!! Not waterproof though. Gets wet but drys fast.
customer_reviews.author: Catelyn Tan

customer_reviews.title: Hiked Grand Canyon in these Apr. 2019
customer_reviews.text: Light, light and Light...weight. Love these....design of spacious toebox is perfect for hiking. WE had all 4 hikers earring these, we all loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Rmsoko

customer_reviews.title: toe box
customer_reviews.text: I love the wider toe box. Greatly reduces the chance of getting blisters on my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S. Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Best boot I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Love Altra lone peak 4 is the best shoe I have ever owned
customer_reviews.author: arrecho

customer_reviews.title: Crappy quality
customer_reviews.text: These shoes began to come apart in the first 8 miles. After 30miles I could feel the tread of the shoe on the bottom of my feet. And yet, I hiked on. After 60 miles the lining has began coming out of my shoe. That isn’t much hiking. Wearing them while sitting on the porch, listening to the rain, they are quite comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Fu

customer_reviews.title: My dogs can breathe!
customer_reviews.text: Love the toe spread allowed but they fit the rest of the feet snugly. My feet are a mess with malformed toes from years of smashing bags in Karate class. Great support and traction in snow. My feet run very hot so these thin boot work nicely with one layer over toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome construction, Comfort and value.
customer_reviews.text: Altra makes a dependable product. Zero drop works for me as well as the ability to splay your toes. Great tread. Sure-footed. Recommend fitted insoles for miles of comfort.
customer_reviews.author: David Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Responsive running feel
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe. Not as much cushion at the Altra Olympus. Good hiking boot
customer_reviews.author: BravoMaxx

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hiking boot that was lightweight and cool. This shoe did all that plus looks great. You will regret this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow fit.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 12, I ordered a size 12. The fit was very narrow and I returned the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Plenty of room for my toes-zero crowding. Really helped with not getting blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great to Hike In
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves them. They are amazing shoes for hiking. Some people suggest sizing up a half size but my boyfriend did not need to. It’s up to your personal preference
customer_reviews.author: ErinMcCarthy1

customer_reviews.title: Altra Lone Peak 4.0
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable items I’ve ever strapped onto my feet. Can’t wait to put them to the test.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FIT AND GREAT SHOE
customer_reviews.text: AWSOME TO HUNT FIRST AND LATE SEASON WESTERN OREGON AS LONG AS YOU WEAR WATERPROOF SOCKS UNDER THEM IN WINTER
customer_reviews.author: Jenelle Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! Never thought a high-top could be so light and do the job so well. Great buying experience as well.
customer_reviews.author: Taurean26.2

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is amazing. Felt like my favorite worn out pair of shoes that fit just right but not worn out. The comfort and feel is great. Definitely would buy another pair and have recommended them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great job, Altra!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They feel good and look great. There is enough ankle support to make the show feel secure enough to use on the trail and they are light enough to take on a morning run. I will be buying another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Feel great
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, ran 13 first run out of the box and they felt fantastic. No hot spots. I was a bit concerned at first because of the zero drop, but are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Crandall

customer_reviews.title: great working/ hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding additional ankle support. Could use a little better arch support. Great toebox room Won me over from Acsics.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Farrow

customer_reviews.title: How we should be running
customer_reviews.text: For the transcendent runner. Zero drop is like rediscovering how to run. It takes time to adjust to zero drop running. Prone to Injury if not properly acclimated.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: If you are a Atria believer, buy 1 size larger.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was just to tight all around. If you wear two pairs of socks, buy big.
customer_reviews.author: stanley kaleta

customer_reviews.title: Will Purchase a Second Pair
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable shoes ever purchased. Didn’t have to break them in and I work 12 hr shifts on me my feet.
customer_reviews.author: brandon gericke

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: This shoe definitely runs small. Had to return and order 1 full size larger.
customer_reviews.author: HyTek Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tred, support, and fit
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing altra shoes for 4 years and these dont disappoint. I broke my back and this is the only brand of shoe I wear. Great shoes buy them, try them, and you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: adam peterson

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Best, most comfortable shoe I ever bought. Will never buy a different hiking boot again
customer_reviews.author: colton kreider

customer_reviews.title: Hiked Zion Narrows
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with how the shoes held up. Used these to walk the Narrows in Zion, great ankle and sole protection. Worked well on slick rocks, and water drained well. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Orlando Carcamo

customer_reviews.title: Best Perfect Spartan Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These r the best trail, hiking, Spartan shoes I have ever used. Im up to 100 miles on them so far. I wear an 8.5 and bought that size originally but for these an 8 was the perfect fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: OD

customer_reviews.title: Blister free and comfortable out of the box. No break-in period.
customer_reviews.text: I put 700+ miles on these on the Appalachian Trail. Could have pushed for more but wanted new tread heading into the White Mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Corkran

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. The Zero Drop really helps my knees on the trails. The toe box fits perfectly. So impressed that I purchased a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: I like these I wear them daily for work I’m on my feet all day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: What a comfortable lightweight shoe. On top of being a great shoe, the custom service people were so nice and fast to get back to me.
customer_reviews.author: michael gocke

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I work in a factory and these shoes are the most comfortable ones I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Moeller

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: great shoes and I have done multiple rucks with them. My favorite pair of shoes right now Army Nurse
customer_reviews.author: Shannon A Barkwell

customer_reviews.text: Amazing grip, able to climb even the most unforgiving surfaces
customer_reviews.author: Kyle OKray

customer_reviews.title: great durability, awesome feel
customer_reviews.text: I walk 8-12 miles a day at work. These are my go to shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Snl

customer_reviews.title: Too wide
customer_reviews.text: Hate how the manufacturer changes the fit on these things. The old versions fit great, this one is too wide.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Altra hit the nail on the head here. Truly a comfortable, light weight boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes. The color looks great too! I use them for trail running.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Favorite
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite fitting shoes! Love the extra room in the toebox.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe buy a size larger than you need.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe it just runs small. The third pair I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for my size
customer_reviews.text: Great show I’ve purchased over a dozen pair of this brand
customer_reviews.author: RICK THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my adult son and he tells me every time he wears them how much he LOVES them. He says they are so comfortable and fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, grippy sole, comfortable mis approach shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect same as other boots and shoes. Comfortable yet to give real test need to see how it does on wet rocks.
customer_reviews.author: W. E. Whitaker

product_meta.title: Altra Men's Lone Peak 4 Mid Mesh Trail Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Lone Peak 4 Mid Mesh-M - FOOTWEAR||MEN'S FOOTWEAR||MEN'S RUNNING
feature_bullets: Allows your toes to relax and spread out naturally for more comfort and stability in uphill climbs and downhill descents.
Places your heel and forefoot the same distance from the ground to encourage proper, low-impact form throughout your trail run.
Hook-and-loop tab allows strapless gaiter attachment that prevents debris from building up beneath the shoe.
Canted lugs positioned strategically beneath the metatarsals to provide traction at toe off
International products have separate terms, are sold from abroad and may differ from local products, including fit, age ratings, and language of product, labeling or instructions.
